section_path: Present on Admission Guidelines > Assigning the POA Indicator > POA Explicitly Documented

content.full_text: Assign Y for any condition the provider explicitly documents as being present on admission. Assign N for any condition the provider explicitly documents as not present at the time of admission. (Evidence: pg no: 118, L24-L26)
content.summary: When providers explicitly document POA status, assign Y for present conditions and N for not present conditions (Evidence: pg no: 118, L24-L26)
key_concepts: Explicit provider documentation (Evidence: pg no: 118, L24-L26)
Y indicator for present conditions (Evidence: pg no: 118, L25)
N indicator for not present conditions (Evidence: pg no: 118, L26)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Assign Y when provider explicitly documents condition as present on admission (Evidence: pg no: 118, L25)
detailed_rules.explanation: Clear provider documentation stating condition was present at admission requires Y indicator (Evidence: pg no: 118, L25)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Assign N when provider explicitly documents condition as not present at admission (Evidence: pg no: 118, L26)
detailed_rules.explanation: Clear provider documentation stating condition was not present at admission requires N indicator (Evidence: pg no: 118, L26)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Review provider documentation for explicit POA statements
Step 2: If explicitly documented as present, assign Y
Step 3: If explicitly documented as not present, assign N
